Implement true VPS bypass by stopping OpenVPN and Shadowsocks

The previous bypass only set multipath=off, but traffic still routed
through VPS because:
- OpenVPN manages tun0 and re-adds routes
- Shadowsocks transparent proxy redirects all TCP to port 1100
- nftables rule: meta l4proto tcp redirect to :1100

Now the bypass properly:
- Stops OpenVPN daemon and kills processes
- Stops Shadowsocks daemon and kills sslocal processes
- Brings down tun0 interface
- Waits 3 seconds for services to stop cleanly

Restore now properly:
- Starts Shadowsocks daemon
- Starts OpenVPN daemon
- Reloads firewall to restore nftables rules
- Reloads network
- Waits 5 seconds for VPN to reconnect

Also updated frontend with:
- Better confirmation dialogs explaining what will happen
- Longer status messages during switching \(~10 seconds\)
- Warning about connection interruption times
